name: Memantine

dosing.notes: Can be taken with or without food. Often used in combination with cholinesterase inhibitors in moderate-severe Alzheimer's. ER once-daily formulation available.

canadian_clinical.titration_schedule: Increase by 5 mg weekly over 4 weeks: Week 1: 5mg, Week 2: 10mg, Week 3: 15mg, Week 4: 20mg.
canadian_clinical.inpatient_strategy: Initiate in stable patients. Follow titration schedule. Monitor for confusion or worsening cognition.
canadian_clinical.outpatient_strategy: Titrate over 4 weeks. Caregivers should monitor for dizziness, confusion, and headache.

cautions.renal: Reduce dose in moderate renal impairment (CrCl 5-29: target 10 mg/day). Avoid in severe impairment.
cautions.hepatic: No specific adjustment required; use caution in severe hepatic impairment.

warnings: Confusion may transiently worsen during titration
Use caution in epilepsy (may lower seizure threshold)
Drug interactions: alkalinizing agents increase memantine levels
citations: CCNA (Canadian Consortium on Neurodegeneration in Aging)
